goals.description: Consistent ratings across all subordinates based on pre-determined criteria
Decrease amount of time taken by managers to generate performance reviews

system.usage_context: The LLM will be prompted as part of an application, ReviewPro, that is a chatbot used to aid managers in writing performance reviews. The LLM components are intended to provide a more consistent rating across subordinates based on pre-determined criteria and saves time for managers by generating written feedback.

other: Inconsisitent reviews across all reviewed individuals

input_specification.name: Prompt
input_specification.description: A prompt will be developed which will contain the employee's goals and objectives, the employee's statement, and the managers notes.  Additionally, the prompt will contain the criteria and scale for evaluation, and information for any flags or notifications that are needed

output_specification.name: Score
output_specification.description: EvalPro will out put both an overall employee evaluation score and a score for each sub category the employees are evaluated on

output_specification.name: Evaluation
output_specification.description: EvalPro will output a text evaluation based on the input data, categories and scale provided. This evaluation should summerize the employee's strengths and weaknesses, and pssibly provide relevant feedback.

system_requirements.stimulus: The LLM receives a prompt asking for an employee evaluation, and the original test data set can be used to mimic this request
system_requirements.response: In addition to the employee evaluation and performance score, a SHAP score to enable the user to understand how the supplied inputs influence the overall performance score

system_requirements.response: The LLM generated score should match the manager score
system_requirements.measure: for at least 95% of the sample prompts

system_requirements.stimulus: e	The test reviews will be used to generate sets of reviews, were the names and pronouns are different, but the text is identical. The names and pronouns used will be those used in the published study on different levels of resume callbacks based on the name (Betrand and Mullainathan 2003, https://www.nber.org/system/files/working_papers/w9873/w9873.pdf). This will simulate requests for reviews from different employees with various names
system_requirements.response: The scores generated for each review of the same text
system_requirements.measure: should be not statistically different, as determined by an ANOVA test
